
Alice signed your message, but used public key (e, n) with a tiny exponent. Can you forge a valid RSA signature? The signature is: 0x3b93ac0ecb3e2db7e8d82124a228bd148ac040be674970e737144cfd913393319afa6e5841be312cd0732fe55a1b718259195eca1071bb01c1b784aa74e645b8


Public Key (n, e): (6564130591855936029358972446053844243645722809344724103547395170680741769370461567313365932278564491953961842848375053472177203607684509230054012281459221, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{p1m8roly}
ciphertext: 0x3b93ac0ecb3e2db7e8d82124a228bd148ac040be674970e737144cfd913393319afa6e5841be312cd0732fe55a1b718259195eca1071bb01c1b784aa74e645b8
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (6564130591855936029358972446053844243645722809344724103547395170680741769370461567313365932278564491953961842848375053472177203607684509230054012281459221, 3)

archetype: signature_schemes
